meanings.definition: The belief that the universe is full of divine energy.
meanings.sent1: Many ancient cultures embraced plenism, seeing the world as brimming with spiritual power.
meanings.sent2: The plenism of nature is evident in the blooming flowers and buzzing bees.
meanings.sent3: The idea of plenism made the forest seem like a magical place, full of hidden wonders.
meanings.sent4: Her heart overflowed with plenism, feeling connected to the energy of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The concept of plenism painted the cosmos as a vibrant tapestry of life and light.

meanings.definition: The state of being full or complete.
meanings.sent1: After a hearty meal, a sense of plenism washed over him, content and satisfied.
meanings.sent2: The plenism of the library shelves brought a sense of fulfillment to the book lover.
meanings.sent3: The plenism of the jar of cookies tempted her to indulge in one more sweet treat.
meanings.sent4: The plenism of the orchestra filled the concert hall with harmonious melodies.
meanings.sent5: The plenism of the garden in full bloom was a sight to behold, every corner bursting with life.
